TopicTitle: SmartASS and fluttering planes -- how to cope?

Articles.Content:
In stock aero, I can handle my planes using SmartASS; usually by putting it into stock SAS mode. In my stockish install there is a mod that provides easy access to the SAS feedback mechanism via contect menu on any command module. I don't know which mod brough that feature, but it's priceless: using SmartASS to give the directions and the tweaked SAS to do it, I can control planes quite well.

Now I've gotten myself RSS+RO which also comes with FAR, but without said mod. I'm still struggling with keeping a plane in the air for more than a few minutes. The plane itself is rather kind, as long as I want to go straight it will fly well enough without any assistance. However, with WASD controls it's quite tedious and only a question of time until I mess up. Getting a flight stick is out of the question. Using SmartASS works in a fashion, but there's constant flutter that never quite settles down and sooner or later escalates without any apparent reason.

There are some FAR modules for mechjeb, but I don't notice any improvement -- if anything, it's become worse. Dear reader: if you can manage to fly in FAR without a stick, please let me know how you do it. If anyone knows which mod exposes the SAS internals and if it's compatible with RSS/RO, that might also help. (found it: Stock Plus)

Edited August 16, 2015 by Laie

Trim. Hold down Alt (on Win) or RShift (on Lin) and the WASDQE keys to dial it in, X resets.

FAR Wing Leveller. Comes with FAR.

Fine controls. Hit Caps Lock.

With those three you can fly OK with the keyboard.
By the description, Pilot Assistant seems to be just what I need. Thanks!
